name: ğŸ” Face ID to Unlock a Phone
explanation: Face ID demonstrates Big Idea 1: Perception (using cameras to capture facial features) and Big Idea 3: Learning (machine learning creates a unique face map that adapts to small changes over time).

name: ğŸ¤– ChatGPT
explanation: ChatGPT exemplifies Big Idea 3: Learning (trained on massive text datasets), Big Idea 4: Natural Interaction (understanding context and generating human-like responses), and raises Big Idea 5: Societal Impact questions about AI in education and work.

name: ğŸ“§ Email Spam Filter
explanation: Spam filters use Big Idea 3: Learning (identifying patterns in junk mail like suspicious keywords, senders, and links) and Big Idea 2: Representation & Reasoning (classifying emails based on learned features).

name: ğŸ—ºï¸ Google Maps Real-Time Traffic
explanation: Google Maps uses Big Idea 1: Perception (gathering location data from phones) and Big Idea 3: Learning (analysing patterns to predict traffic jams and suggest optimal routes).

name: ğŸš™ Basic Cruise Control
explanation: Basic cruise control is an automated system but not AI - it simply maintains a set speed. It lacks Big Idea 1: Perception (can't sense other cars) and Big Idea 3: Learning (doesn't adapt to conditions).

name: ğŸ§ An ATM
explanation: An ATM follows a secure, pre-programmed sequence of steps. It lacks Big Idea 2: Representation & Reasoning (can't make decisions outside its programming) and Big Idea 3: Learning (doesn't improve over time).

name: ğŸ“² A QR Code Scanner
explanation: A QR scanner is a simple decoder that translates visual patterns into data. While it uses a camera, this isn't Big Idea 1: Perception in the AI sense - no learning, inference, or understanding occurs.

name: ğŸŒ¡ï¸ A Digital Thermostat
explanation: A basic thermostat is a simple sensor and switch that turns heating/cooling on or off at a set temperature. It lacks Big Idea 3: Learning (can't optimise based on your habits) unlike smart thermostats.

name: ğŸ“± TikTok 'For You' Page
explanation: TikTok's algorithm demonstrates Big Idea 3: Learning (tracking viewing habits with extreme detail to personalise content). This raises significant Big Idea 5: Societal Impact concerns about attention, mental health, and content bubbles.

name: ğŸ¯ Personalised Ads
explanation: Targeted advertising uses Big Idea 3: Learning (building profiles from browsing history to predict purchasing behaviour). This is a key example of Big Idea 5: Societal Impact - raising privacy and manipulation concerns.
